item.title: 2022.03.09 - Daily Notes (Wednesday)
item.description:
☀️ Clear +27°F

One of those days, I see.

Your channel would be better without those LEDs in the background.

I had this crazy thought today of simply copying and pasting each day's note from here into Substack. You know, like that newsletter I was trying last year.

Introducing the Substack app. Remember when Substack was a newsletter tool?

item.title: 2022.03.08 - Daily Notes (Tuesday)
item.description:
☁️ Overcast +31°F

Hi. It's 4:00 am. What will I do with the day? And who am I going to be?

I started using Elfeed for reading RSS in Emacs again. It gets old due to the very plain-text nature of reading posts, but it's fun and fast for a while.

you can’t just abbreviate phrases all william nilliam

— slate (@PleaseBeGneiss) March 7, 2022

I don't enjoy deciding where to put things. If I was smart, I would keep a local "knowledgebase" in Org-roam or Logseq or something and skip this wiki entirely. Anything I felt like sharing could go on the blog or social media. As it stands, whenever I want to write something down about a technical solution or process I have to decide if it goes local (private) or on the wiki. Hate that.

Web pages are ghosts: they’re like images projected onto a wall. They aren’t durable. If you turn off the projector (i.e. web server), the picture disappears. If you know how to run a projector, and you can keep it running all the time, you can have a web site.

The Unbearable Lightness of Web Pages

Looks like Paul Ford is involved with Aboard - A wonderful way to work together somehow. That's enough to get me interested.

I want that new display. Badly.

item.title: 2022.03.07 - Daily Notes (Monday)
item.description:
Part of why I get bored writing here (or anywhere) is that staring at the same thing for too long becomes tedious. Recently, Alex rebuilt his wiki and it's using the Zacht theme for TiddlyWiki, which I thought looked nice, so I'm giving it a try here. Hope he doesn't mind.

I've pretty much lost all interest in Project Gemini. I don't understand what problem it solves. I know what it thinks it solves, but those problems have either already been solved or could easily be solved with run-of-the-mill HTML and friends plus a modicum of restraint.

You’re not suffering from ‘vicarious trauma’, you’re tweeting in your living room

Stop making the Ukraine war about you

item.title: 2022.03.03 - Daily Notes (Thursday)
item.description:
⛅️ Partly cloudy +19°F

Today is "where do I write things down day". Apparently.

I love this wiki and daily.baty.net equally.

item.title: 2022.03.02 - Daily Notes (Wednesday)
item.description: I'm at least creating placeholders here for each day. Gives any other entries something to hang from.

item.title: 2022.03.01 - Daily Notes (Tuesday)
item.description:
☀️ Clear +34°F

Looking at server analytics shows that a vast majority of the "hits" to daily.baty.net are to the RSS file. Am I being selfish or at least unhelpful by writing here with no feed? I think I'll just keep using both, and choose one depending on my mood.

Want: the Cyberdeck

item.title: 2022.02.28 - Daily Notes (Monday)
item.description:
⛅️ Partly cloudy +22°F

▓▓▓▓▓░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░░ 16%

And yet, here we are.

I wake up each day an entirely different person. Or, perhaps more accurately, I wake up in one of a number of different configurations. Today's configuration is around wikis and why I have one. Yesterday I wrote, in The Daily Notes Dilemma that I thought a blog made more sense for these daily notes. But, I lay awake last night thinking that I was wrong. The whole point of these notes is self-reflection and thinking out loud. These notes are not for you, lovely reader, they are for me. A pleasant, consistent, familiar reading experience is not the priority here. This is my house. You're welcome to hang out, but you'll have to excuse the mess. But also, if I'm being honest, there is some performance here. So although this thing is meant for me, it's available for anyone to read. And of course I like that people read it. Readership isn't the goal, though. It's just a happy side effect.

Ordered some Naptha (well, lighter fluid and mineral spirits) in order to try and clean the Focomat threads.

I don't know how half the shit works around here. I wanted to add something to the "New Movie" button's actions and the way the button works is a complete mystery. I'm sure I copied and pasted it from somewhere and who knows what it actually does? I need to remember to stop tweaking everything and just use the damn tool. (And stay out of the forums unless I have a specific issue or question).

I'm trying to think of a job for which I'd come remotely close to passing a decent interview. Nothing comes to mind.

Can someone please make an Emacs script that mimics the features of Doing by Brett Terpstra? I have an Org capture template that creates entries, but would like some of the other parsing stuff, too.

Canceled my SiriusXM subscription. I'm never in my car and don't listen to it anywhere else.

I canceled Hey.com so it won't renew in June. I don't need a $100/year email service. I'm perfectly happy with Fastmail for half as much

I've stopped worrying about contradicting myself or changing my mind. It's just me.

The great consolidation continues. I'm canceling my MicroDotBlog subscription. I'll just use Twitter and Mastodon for now.

The MacBook Pro M1 Max (2020) screen is really really good. I love the big 32" LG but man that crazy Retina thing is nice.

minad/org-modern: Modern Org Style. Tries to make Org look fancy. Not sure it's necessary, but I'm trying it anyway.

item.title: 2022.02.26 - Daily Notes (Saturday)
item.description: I can't decide if this should be a real wiki or just the place I dump all the random shit I'm thinking about every day. I would prefer it be the former, but there's so little friction that it ends up being the latter. Update: yeah, I'm doing it at daily.baty.net for a while and see where it goes.

item.title: 2022.02.25 - Daily Notes (Friday)
item.description:
🌨 Light snow, mist +19°F

I tried to fix the toilet 3 times and every time there was still something wrong with it. Plus, the shutoff wasn't shutting off and it was a soldered joint so I punted and called a plumber. He was in and out in a half-hour. Smart move, I think.

Playing with flash today

If you need photos of my dog, desk, notebooks, cameras, or self... I'm your guy!

I get bored, but never this bored: "The Rube Goldberg machine of all Rube Goldberg machines" / Twitter

item.title: 2022.02.24 - Daily Notes (Thursday)
item.description:
Russia attacking Ukraine sucks. I'm not qualified to say anything more meaningful about it, though. Just that it sucks.

The worst thing I can do for my productivity is read the Mac Power Users forum.

item.title: 2022.02.23 - Daily Notes (Wednesday)
item.description:
I'm trying to stay as varied and inconsistent as possible with my daily doodles.

I've resurrected baty.net and it's running WordPress.

I tried with the new WordPress "Full Site Editing" and Twenty Twenty Two theme but just couldn't get my head around it. Back to Hive.

It's 2022, I'm 57 years old and I am still terrible at Photoshop. I don't have a 3D printer nor know how to use one. I haven't written a single novel. Linux is 50% a mystery. A cannot play an instrument. I (barely) speak only one language. There's more, but I'm too disgusted with myself to continue.

Nothing inspires me to shoot more film than buying a really expensive digital camera. Apparently.

item.title: 2022.02.22 - Daily Notes (Tuesday)
item.description:
🌫 Mist +32°F

Good morning. Today is Tooosday, Tooo Twenty Tooo, Tooo thousand and Twenty Tooo.

Watched 2 photography-related documentaries yesterday. The first was Ricky Powell: The Individualist (2020) - IMDb. Talk about being in the right place at the right time. Dude is a mess and kind of a dick. I think he was mostly lucky and persistent. Some cool photos, though. The second film was Harry Benson: Shoot First (2016) - IMDb. It started with the beatles and never stopped. I like him. And wow, some terrific photography. And not just rock stars. He always got the shot.

I'm beginning to feel that fancy, expensive computer setups are a sign of someone with the wrong hobby. Or at least the wrong priorities.

If no one knew what cameras I used, I'd still use a Leica.

On the other hand, I wish my little Ricoh GR1 still worked.

The OM-2n was looking lonely, so I put a roll of TMAX-100 in it and strapped the flash on top.

2022.02.22 - Copingmechanism.com is now photoblog.baty.net

item.title: 2022.02.21 - Daily Notes (Monday)
item.description:
I am working toward keeping all of my web "properties" under a single domain, baty.net. You'll notice that all requests to rudimentarylathe.wiki now redirect to rl.baty.net.

I may need another (?) note-taking detox. Yesterday, I nearly installed Bear again. That's a sign of being off the rails. I like Bear just fine, but it's never going to be the thing I use to take notes. I was simply bored with everything else and wanted something new to play with. Needs to stop.

Computers are an addiction and I'm a junkie.

Maybe not, but writing that down and posting a photo of it online certainly is.

DHH just keeps digging himself a deeper hole of stupid.

When was the last time I shared something I made instead of yapping on and on about the tooling I might one day maybe use to make something?

For no good reason, I'm considering moving everything into one domain (baty.net) and letting go of everything else. I'd go with something like rl.baty.net for the wiki, and blog.baty.net for blog, etc. One small annual fee. One DNS zone to deal with. Sounds inviting to me.

item.title: 2022.02.20 - Daily Notes (Sunday)
item.description:
The Leica MP arrived back from repairs at Leica yesterday. The rewind knob works like butter now. Feels similar to the M3, which I use as a benchmark for how a camera should feel. They replaced a roller and the leather covering.

I need to remember to make small, granular entries here. Then collect some or all of them into these daily note posts. It makes search and tiddler lists much more useful.

People use Markdown too much, for too many things. It's supposed to be a simple markup syntax for readable plain text meant to be rendered as HTML.

Still trying to get Hook to become a habit, but I always forget about it.

I just took the leather case off my 1960 Leica M3 and slipped it onto my 2021 MP and it fits perfectly. Kind of amazing.

I'm in a mood that makes me want to just use simple tools straight out of the box. No fancy scripting, or customizations, or workflow automatations, etc. Remember

Jack self-portrait (2022). Leica MP. 50mm Summilux. HP5.

item.title: 2022.02.19 - Daily Notes (Saturday)
item.description:
🌨 Light snow, blowing snow +10°F

Brrrr. That wind isn't helping.

Went out for drinks and dinner last night. Felt good about it being almost empty of other people. Bar. Grand Rapids, 2022. (Leica M6. 50mm Summilux. HP5)

This wiki is very personal. It's more a private journal that I accidently put on the web. There's no reason this should be online at all, but knowing that it's public helps me want to write more, even though I know only a very few beautiful and intelligent people will ever read it.

Wrote a short post about Music: Stream or Buy?. Listening to my new (FLAC) copy of Zeal & Ardor and I'm enjoying it very much.

item.title: 2022.02.18 - Daily Notes (Friday)
item.description:
☁️ Overcast +16°F

I have, almost accidentally, started using TiddlyWiki for my personal Journal/Daybook. It bagan when I opened an old attempt and it just sort of felt right. It didn't hurt that Emacs was throwing errors for some reason every time I'd capture anything. Plus, I think I needed a break from all-text-all-the-time. It happens occasionally.

I need to shoot a roll of film outdoors so I don't need to worry about camera blur or missed focus (as much).

My favorite new practice is to highlight the important words in my notes. I do this both here (as seen in the previous sentence) and in my paper notebooks. It makes things much easier to scan.

I wish I had just one website

item.title: 2022.02.17 - Daily Notes (Thursday)
item.description:
🌦 Light rain, mist +40°F

I feel like I'm missing a way to manage posts in Write.as but I can't think of why I need it. Still feels like a gap, though.

My watercolor experiment has been a failure. I feel I have no control over the paint and I can't mix colors to save my life. And practicing is no fun, so I think I'll put everything away for a while.

item.title: 2022.02.16 - Daily Notes (Wednesday)
item.description:
I feel like I belong here on the wiki today. Something I've known and am re-realizing is that if I'd just stop putzing around and just live in TiddlyWiki I would have everything I need.

I've posted a couple photography-related things to the Write.as blog when they belong on Copingmechanism.com. I just don't enjoy posting to WordPress so I avoid it. And using things like Ulysses or MarsEdit don't really help for some reason.

There's just no energy right now for doing the right things the right way.

item.title: 2022.02.15 - Daily Notes (Tuesday)
item.description:
Click, and here's a new daily post. Easy peasy. And here's a photo of my dog.

One thing I dislike about the Hive theme I'm using at Copingmechanism.com is that it looks stupid without featured images on every post and I don't like being forced to come up with an image for every post. And yet, there I am over on Write.as putting images on nearly every post, without even thinking about it.

I'd like more metal like Zeal & Ardor. Use the hoarse-Grover growling as the spice, not the meat.

Want: Off-Grid Cyberdeck! The Raspberry Pi Recovery Kit — BACK7

Your hexagonal Twitter avatar looks a lot like a MAGA hat to me.

I need to stop talking, reading, and thinking about cameras for a while.

item.title: 2022.02.14 - Daily Notes (Monday)
item.description:
☁️ Overcast +6°F

Good morning, it's 4:15 am and here we are again.

You may have noticed that I've been posting daily notes both here and on Baty.blog. This is because I like doing it equally in both places and I can't find a path to choosing one of them. The wiki is just so easy and I like that it's right next to most of my other notes. When I don't write here regularly, the rest of the information languishes. It loses its "wikiness". On the other hand, with baty.blog I get to write in Emacs using Org-mode and publish a good-looking "normal" blog with RSS feeds and archives and all the other things that I love about blogs. I think that TiddlyWiki is the best long-term answer, but Hugo is what I prefer living with today. Still noodlin' on it.

In elevating frontend to the land of Serious Code we have not just made things incredibly over-engineered but we have also set fire to all the ladders that we used to get up here in the first place.

The web without the web

I'm increasingly uncomfortable with my baty.net domain redirecting to omg.lol but I don't know what to do about it. (UPDATE: I stole the omg.lol layout, etc and am running it as a static site at baty.net. This is temporary)

"The Book of Boba Fett" is a no-fun combination of 50% fan service and 50% stupid.
